data.title: #define TORQUE_RELEASE doesnt get defined for release builds

milestone.description: This version will focus on processing two of the major outstanding pull requests, James Urquhart's [TorqueScript interpreter improvements](https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/pull/81) and Tim Condon's [GUI additions](https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/pull/545). Along with that we'll be bringing in lots of other TS-related enhancements, adding unit tests for TS to make sure we don't break your games, and processing even more of the outstanding issue list.

data.body: When browsing through the torqueConfig.h, I noticed that TORQUE_RELEASE wasn't defined when it was a release build but TORQUE_DEBUG would define properly.

data.title: nvidia nsight debugger support.

milestone.description: This version will focus on processing two of the major outstanding pull requests, James Urquhart's [TorqueScript interpreter improvements](https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/pull/81) and Tim Condon's [GUI additions](https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/pull/545). data.body: requires defining the TORQUE_NSIGHT_WORKAROUND preprocessor macro

data.title: Added invalid text visual feedback
data.body: Now instead of just having a sound when you enter bad text there is some visual feedback as well.

data.title: Color conversion
data.body: Added a bunch of code to convert from/to different color formats.

data.title: Added functions
data.body:
This is a plethora of added functions, improvements to existing functionality, opening of some things to script and other misc changes that everyone could benefit from.

I was going to try to break it up into more branches, but most of these things are nice and it would be a lot of pull request. Also I am not sure how I would group them. I am willing to remove things or change code that people thing aren't.

data.title: Tcp additions
data.body: Added several little additions to the TCPObject such as sending a file, callbacks for when everything is finished, and extra script methods.

data.title: Improved file open dialogue
data.body: Added some extra parameters to open file dialogue and added a check to findConstructor so it doesn't throw errors.

data.title: JSON support
data.body:
Added a JSON class that is open to script  and inherits from the array object. It is basically the same as the array object only with some added functions/variables to handle the type handling and writing out to a string.

There is no reading in, perhaps that can be added by someone else or in the future.

data.title: Documentation

milestone.description: This version will focus on processing two of the major outstanding pull requests, James Urquhart's [TorqueScript interpreter improvements](https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/pull/81) and Tim Condon's [GUI additions](https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/pull/545). Along with that we'll be bringing in lots of other TS-related enhancements, adding unit tests for TS to make sure we don't break your games, and processing even more of the outstanding issue list.

data.body: I added/fixed some documentation. If it was incorrect documentation it was changed, if there were inconsistencies in variable names I changed them and if something wasn't documented I added it.

data.title: Bug fixes
data.body: After working with torque for a while I have noticed several bugs. Those bugs have been fixed in this branch.

data.title: Crash 3.6.3 GUI Editor Locks Up

milestone.description: This version will focus on processing two of the major outstanding pull requests, James Urquhart's [TorqueScript interpreter improvements](https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/pull/81) and Tim Condon's [GUI additions](https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/pull/545). Along with that we'll be bringing in lots of other TS-related enhancements, adding unit tests for TS to make sure we don't break your games, and processing even more of the outstanding issue list.

data.body:
Keep getting a crash/lockup in the new 3.6.3. Stock code, built with Project Manager 2.2 beta (+ missing xml file)
Open GUI editor up and then close twice and it all crashes.
Note: not an issue in 3.6.2.

To reproduce method 1:
Start a level, start GUI editor (F10), close it, reopen GUI editor (F10), close it again and crash/lock.
The error which loops into eternity.
To reproduce method 2:
At MainMenu open GUI Editor, close it, open it again and close aghain and crash/lock.
To reproduce method 3:
Open GUI Editor once, then exit and quit Torque. Lots of errors but T3D will quit before it locks.

The error which loops to crash:

> tools/guiEditor/scripts/guiEditorCanvas.ed.cs (223): Unknown command delete.
>  Object (4479) MenuBuilder

The script: tools/guiEditor/scripts/guiEditorCanvas.ed.cs

> /// Called before onSleep when the canvas content is changed
> function GuiEditCanvas::onDestroyMenu(%this)
> {
>    if( !isObject( %this.menuBar ) )
>       return;
> 
>    // Destroy menus  
>    while( %this.menuBar.getCount() != 0 )
>       %this.menuBar.getObject( 0 ).delete();//yorks - here be dragons!
> 
>    %this.menuBar.removeFromCanvas();
>    %this.menuBar.delete();
> }

Thread I opened on the forums:
http://forums.torque3d.org/viewtopic.php?f=2&t=29

data.title: setMathControlState is not implemented on Mac, Linux, or X64 Windows
data.body: Platform::setMathControlState does not appear to be implemented for Mac, Linux, or X64 Windows. This function turns out to be very important as otherwise you will get weird rounding errors on floating point operations during execution.

data.title: Fix VS2008

milestone.description: This version will focus on processing two of the major outstanding pull requests, James Urquhart's [TorqueScript interpreter improvements](https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/pull/81) and Tim Condon's [GUI additions](https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/pull/545). Along with that we'll be bringing in lots of other TS-related enhancements, adding unit tests for TS to make sure we don't break your games, and processing even more of the outstanding issue list.

data.body: `stdint.h` doesn't exist in VS2008, so add an inline polyfill for the one type we need from it, `unitptr_t`. This is a stopgap solution; VS2008 support will likely be deprecated soon, but I'd prefer to do it deliberately and with announcement rather than accidentally.

data.title: Gestalt no longer works on Mac OSX Yosemite
data.body:
The Gestalt() function was deprecated since Mac OSX Mountain Lion. It no longer works properly on Yosemite, as the operating system returns mavericks while running Yosemite. A replacement will have to be made for newer versions of OSX.

(Not surprising it stopped working, it was a really old Carbon API function...)

I know It's kinda early to start reporting OSX bugs, but I am doing some work on OSX after all... ;)

data.title: Fix for console stack

milestone.description: This version will focus on processing two of the major outstanding pull requests, James Urquhart's [TorqueScript interpreter improvements](https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/pull/81) and Tim Condon's [GUI additions](https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/pull/545). Along with that we'll be bringing in lots of other TS-related enhancements, adding unit tests for TS to make sure we don't break your games, and processing even more of the outstanding issue list.

data.body:
Refactors console execution in order to resolve issue #1134. It does this by changing executef calls to templates which internally manage the stack, similar to how most modern C++ script binding libraries work. The templates also automatically perform type conversion, meaning you don't even need to bother converting your parameters to TorqueScript types - this is all done for you.

Along with this, all public execution calls (such as execute\* and evaluate_) now save and restore the stack upon returning. They are also now thread safe, meaning they can be called from other threads (as long as get_Arg functions aren't used).

I've also added some basic tests for the core marshalling functionality in addition to the execution calls. This should hopefully trap any expected future regressions with this functionality.

In addition some callbacks have been corrected to use the correct types instead of strings which was causing a few problems.

data.title: Revise OpengL texture format GFXFormatB8G8R8A8
Name of new intptr_t and uintptr_t types.
data.body:
Last changes to x64 builds use those 2 types.

Some ppl commented to me that dont look consistent with T3D types.

We can use SPTR and UPTR types, but i dont really like... i prefer use c++ types.

What you think?
